CatDescriptText: Image published in advertisement in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 10, 1960, pg. 15, with text reading: "Now open the magnificent Jones Funeral Home - An exterior view of the Jones Funeral home and some of the crowd at the Grand Opening on Sunday, Dec. 4. Beautifully Designed and Decorated with Imported Lighting Fixtures and Modern, by Dignified Furnishings Worthy to Express the Deepest Emotions.  Wylie Ave. at Francis St., 24-Hour Service, Samuel J. Jones, Funeral Director."
TitMainTitle: Crowd of women, including Marlene Stevens McEnheimer in doorway, and men, including Hop Kendrick standing in center wearing coat and smoking cigarette, gathered on sidewalk in front of Jones Funeral Home for grand opening, next to Brownie's Beauty Salon, corner of Wylie Avenue and Francis Street, Hill District
